  • Information Theory

Information Theory¶

class simulate.information_theory.IFT.IFT¶

Bases: object

Information Flow Theory for matching and evaluating distributions.

KL(IP: Info, IQ: Info) → float¶

Calculates Kullback-Leibler divergence between two Info instances.

Parameters:

  • IP (Info) – Info instance representing the first distribution.

  • IQ (Info) – Info instance representing the second distribution.

Returns:

The Kullback-Leibler divergence between IP and IQ.

Return type:

float

get_info_difference(P: Info, Q: Info) → Info¶

Returns the difference between two Info instances.

Parameters:

  • P (Info) – First Info instance.

  • Q (Info) – Second Info instance.

Returns:

The difference between P and Q, or an Info instance with zero values if not positive.

Return type:

Info

make_average_opinion(norm_weights: ndarray, infos: list[Info]) → Info¶

Calculates the average opinion based on weighted Infos.

Parameters:

  • norm_weights (np.ndarray) – Normalized weights for each Info instance.

  • infos (list[Info]) – List of Info instances to average.

Returns:

An Info instance representing the average opinion.

Return type:

Info

match(trust: float, Itruth: Info, Ilie: Info, Istart: Info) → Info¶

Matches moments based on trust level.

Parameters:

  • trust (float) – Trust level between 0 and 1, where 0 corresponds to complete reliance on Ilie and 1 on Itruth.

  • Itruth (Info) – The Info instance representing the truthful distribution.

  • Ilie (Info) – The Info instance representing the deceptive distribution.

  • Istart (Info) – The starting Info instance to help in moment matching.

Returns:

A new Info instance representing the matched distribution.

Return type:

Info

match_moments(trust: float, Itruth: Info, Ilie: Info) → Info¶

Matches moments between two Info instances based on trust level.

Parameters:

  • trust (float) – Trust level between 0 and 1.

  • Itruth (Info) – Info instance for the truthful distribution.

  • Ilie (Info) – Info instance for the deceptive distribution.

Returns:

A new Info instance with matched moments.

Return type:

Info

minimize_KL(u: float, v: float, mu_start: float = 0, la_start: float = 0) → tuple[float, float]¶

Minimizes the KL divergence based on specified moments.

Parameters:

  • u (float) – First moment.

  • v (float) – Second moment.

  • mu_start (float, optional) – Initial guess for mu. Defaults to 0.

  • la_start (float, optional) – Initial guess for la. Defaults to 0.

Returns:

A tuple containing the optimized mu and la values.

Return type:

tuple[float, float]

simulate.information_theory.IFT.jLoss(u: float, v: float, MIN_KL: float, J: ndarray) → float¶

Loss function for matching moments between distributions.

Parameters:

  • u (float) – First moment.

  • v (float) – Second moment.

  • MIN_KL (float) – Minimum Kullback-Leibler divergence value.

  • J (np.ndarray) – Current values for mu and la.

Returns:

Computed loss value.

Return type:

float

simulate.information_theory.IFT.jgradLoss(u: float, v: float, MIN_KL: float, J: ndarray) → ndarray¶

Gradient of the loss function.

Parameters:

  • u (float) – First moment.

  • v (float) – Second moment.

  • MIN_KL (float) – Minimum Kullback-Leibler divergence value.

  • J (np.ndarray) – Current values for mu and la.

Returns:

Gradient of the loss with respect to mu and la.

Return type:

np.ndarray

simulate.information_theory.IFT.jhessLoss(u: float, v: float, MIN_KL: float, J: ndarray) → ndarray¶

Hessian of the loss function.

Parameters:

  • u (float) – First moment.

  • v (float) – Second moment.

  • MIN_KL (float) – Minimum Kullback-Leibler divergence value.

  • J (np.ndarray) – Current values for mu and la.

Returns:

Hessian matrix of the loss function.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class simulate.information_theory.info.Info(mu: float = 0, la: float = 0)¶

Bases: object

Represents information with parameters for a Beta distribution. Instances of this class are the main mathematical object for Information Theoretical calculations in simulation.

mu¶

First shape parameter of the Beta distribution.

Type:

float

la¶

Second shape parameter of the Beta distribution.

Type:

float

mean¶

Mean of the Beta distribution calculated from mu and la.

Type:

float

check_positive() → bool¶

Checks if mu and la are non-negative.

draw() → float¶

Draws a sample from the Beta distribution.

round(digits: int) → Info¶

Rounds mu and la to specified digits.

round_mean() → float¶

Returns the rounded mean value.
